moves.1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d6 4. d4 c5 5: Transposing into modern benoni line with Bf4. This should not give black to much difficulty if he has experience in such lines of which I have plenty.
moves.7... a6:
!?
Alternative variation: 7... Bg7 8. Qa4+ Bd7 9. Qb3 b5 [⩲]
Alternative variation: 7... Nbd7 8. h3 Bg7 [⩲]
moves.8. a4 Bg7 9. h3 O-O 10. e3: Anti main line: White wishes to devoid black of excellent counter attacks against e4. Which often arise in the Bf4 lines.
moves.10... Qe7: Alternative variation: 10... Re8 11. Nd2 Nbd7 12. Be2 Ne5 [ small edge to white]
moves.13. Re1 Ne8: with the idea of ...Nc7 to support b7-b5
moves.14. e4 Nc7: Alternative variation: 14... Ne5 15. Nxe5 Bxe5 16. Bxe5 Qxe5 [∞]
moves.15. Qd2 Re8 16. Bf1: clearing the e-file for the up coming exchanges on e5.
moves.16... Ne5 17. Nxe5 Bxe5 18. Bxe5 Qxe5 19: white has a slight edge due to his centre pawns. But he can not use them because the Knight on c7 holds the pawn on e4 in order to protect d5. Furthermore, black has slightly better attacking chances due to the fact that the white king is a little more exposed. So all and all the position is dynamically equal.
moves.19... Qd4+ 20. Qf2 Qxf2+ 21. Kxf2 Kf8: I give up a little more in the centre to keep the position dynamic. .
moves.22. e5 Rd8 23. Rad1 f5: [∞] I might have not calculated everything as white looks pretty good.
moves.24. e6:
?!
Alternative variation: [⌓] 24. g3 Ke7 25. Rd2 b5 26. a5 h5 [∞]
moves.24... Ke7: ! The king block aids the pawn and the position.
moves.25. Rd2 b5 26. Ra1 b4 27. Nd1 b3: Keeping the only possible file that can be opened closed
moves.28. Rc1 a5 29. Ne3 Rb4: at least I have one good piece
moves.30. Rc4 Rb6 31. g4: ! nice idea to try and crack open the f-file but I find away to keep it closed.
moves.32. Rc3 Rb4 33. Kg3 h5:
!!
Alternative variation: 33... Rxa4 [??] 34. Rxb3 Rd4 35. Rxd4 cxd4 gives white control of a open file.
moves.34. Rc4 Rb6 35. Bd3 Ba6 36. g5+: closing the king side for good. Now everything shifts to the fight for the B-file of which I have control
If white can win control of the b-file he will win the game. However, I seriously doubt he has enough wood to make that happen.
moves.39... Rdb8 40. Rxb4 Rxb4: White invests a rook to gain control of the b-file but it still is well in my control
moves.41. b3 Rb6 42. Nc4: Alternative variation: 42. Kf3 Kf8 43. Nc4 Ra6 [=]
moves.42... Ra6 43. h4 Kf8 44. Kf3 Ke7: The king goes back to blockading duty
All I have to do is shuffle the rook back and further for the draw. But!!!
moves.49. Rd1 Rb8 50. Rd2 Rc8 51. Rd3: Alternative variation: 51. Nc4 Nxc4 52. bxc4 Rb8 53. Rb2 Rxb2 54. Kxb2 [=]
moves.51... Rb8 52. Rd1 Rc8 53. Rd2 Rb8 54. Nc:
? I should have just moved the rook and let Shamash offer a draw. But instead I put the insane idea in his head that he had something here.

gameName: My Epic battle against Shamash that lasts just shy of 3 years
